titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Charles Lewis Tarter (1907-1997) was an African-American Presbyterian minister. Tarter served at Saint Augustine Presbyterian Church, Paterson, New Jersey, from 1939 to 1961. From 1961 he served as supply pastor and visiting minister to churches in New Jersey. During World War II Tarter served in Asia as a Captain in the Chaplain Corps. After retirement in 1964 he worked as a Probation Officer in Passaic County, New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Charles L. Tarter. Materials include: notes for sermons; personal notes; church bulletins from the St. Augustine Presbyterian Church and other churches; newspaper clippings about Rev. Tarter and the St. Augustine Church; memorial booklets for Tarter and his wife, Mauretta Veronica Tarter (both from 1997); and Bureau of Vital Statistics forms recording marriages performed by Tarter. The collection also includes a few personal papers, including membership cards and photostatic copies of diplomas and military certificates.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Dr. Ronald H. Watts (via McCloud, J. Oscar)
